Hi, i'm abit new to this so please forgive my asking but what is the big issue with seeding? I thought seeding was just having it there for others to download, y is that such a problem? what am i missing?

Cheers

@ScottyD7421

Seeding is what happens when you've already got the file downloaded to your computer; once that happens, you computer automatically begins sending out pieces of the component parts of the file so others can download it. It works by continually uploading small bits of the overall file, while other people continually download those small bits from everybody who's seeding.

When you first make a torrent, you seed it by yourself until somebody else can download it, then the two of you seed it together. Because of the way seeding works, the larger the number of people seeding, the more efficient downloading the torrent is. 

The downside of this is that it's not like it's stored online for anybody to download it until someone removes it- though that is what makes it such an effective pirating tool. But if there are no seeders, if people just stop caring and drop the torrent, then it's dead, and no one can download it. 

Fear not though, if you'll follow the link I posted in a previous comment, I posted a new version of this torrent, which has a great seeding ratio going on, so you should all probably switch over to that. 

And remember, once you've got the file: SEED!
